actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a credit for physicians commencing medical practice in rural areas.

summary.text: Rural Physicians Tax Credit Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a tax credit for physicians who commence practice in a rural area. Allows such credit for the year such commencement occurs and the three succeeding taxable years. Limits such credit to $5,000. Requires the physician to practice medicine in the rural area for at least nine months in a taxable year.

titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a credit for physicians commencing medical practice in rural areas.
